questions.question: I show up with a smile when you feel good inside.
I make you shiver and wear a jacket.
I purr, chase mice, and love to nap in the sun.
I'm faster than walking; you do me in races.
I light up the day and keep the Earth warm.
I'm a color, like the sky or the ocean.
I'm round and fun to kick, throw, or bounce.
I go up off the ground with both feet.
You do this with food, three times a day.
You sit on me to rest your legs. I have four legs.
I have pages and words — you read me for fun or facts.
I'm white, cold, and come from cows.
I have roots, a trunk, and leaves — I give shade.
I curve your lips upward when you're happy.
I face danger without fear — like a firefighter or hero.
I show care and help others feel good.
I come with joy, often with a big sound.
You do this to a ball or falling object with your hands.
You do this with blocks or bricks to make something tall.
You do this with soap and water to get clean.
I flow down to the ocean and fish swim in me.
I am red or green, crunchy, and grow on trees.
I have a face and hands but no body; I tell time.
I am a big cat with orange fur and black stripes.
You do this in your sleep when your eyes are closed.
I have a roof and walls; you live inside me.
I shine at night and change my shape in the sky.
You wear these on your feet before going outside.
I am a large bird that flies high and hunts.
I am green, cover the ground, and cows eat me.
I am clear, I have no taste, and you drink me.
You use us to see the world around you.
I carry my house on my back and move very slowly.
I fall from the clouds and make puddles.
I come from wood and you write on me.
I am sweet, sticky, and made by bees.
I run on tracks and have a whistle.
You lie on me at night with a pillow.
I am yellow, sour, and shaped like a football.
Mixing blue and yellow paint makes this color.
Earth, Mars, and Venus are examples of this.
I have eight legs and spin a sticky web.
You move your body to the rhythm of music.
I am round, cheesy, and sliced into triangles.
I have lead inside and an eraser on top.
I pump blood inside your chest.
I bring thunder, lightning, and heavy rain.
A place with sand and ocean where you swim.
Songs, melodies, and tunes are all called this.
The color of snow, milk, and clouds.
I am what you do in a bed at night to rest.
I am colorful, smell nice, and bees love me.
I am inside your head and help you think.
I am land surrounded by water on all sides.
You make sandwiches with two slices of me.
I love bananas, climb trees, and have a tail.
Look at me to see your own face.
You use this to speak or sing songs.
A large place filled with many trees and animals.
I float in the sky and look like cotton.
I follow you on a sunny day but disappear in the dark.
I help you cross over a river or a road.
You use me to take photographs.
The coldest season of the year, when it might snow.
I fly very fast into space to reach the moon.
I help sick people get better.
The color of the sun, lemons, and bananas.
You have five of these on each hand.
A round shape like a ring or a ball.
The place children go to learn and study.
The empty place between stars and planets.
I bring heavy rain, thunder, and lightning.
This direction is the opposite of South.
I have leaves, a stem, and I grow from the ground.
A trick used by magicians to amaze people.
You use this to clean your teeth.
We eat this meal in the middle of the day.
A machine that can move and do work like a human.
I am white, float in the air, and disappear.
The time when the sun is down and the moon is up.
I breathe fire, fly, and have scales.
A very large body of salt water.
A loud sound that might hurt your ears.
Apples, bananas, and oranges are types of this.
The opposite of loud; when there is silence.
I look like a horse but have black and white stripes.
A fun celebration with cake, music, and balloons.
I am white, sweet, and used to bake cakes.
I work in a hospital and help the doctor.
I have wings and engines to fly in the sky.
A large vehicle used to carry heavy loads.
The planet we live on.
Furniture with four legs where you eat meals.
You use this utensil to eat soup or cereal.
The feeling of being joyful and glad.
It hangs on the wall and tells you the time.
You use this body part to speak and eat.
You walk up these to reach the next floor.
A person you like, trust, and enjoy playing with.
A big fish in the ocean with sharp teeth.
I am made of wax and give light when burned.
I am yellow, made from milk, and spread on toast.
You carry groceries or a picnic in this.
A very young cat.
I have long ears, a fluffy tail, and I hop.
I move slowly and carry a hard shell on my back.
A colorful bird that can copy human speech.
A reptile with scales that loves the sun.
I have no legs and I slither on the ground.
A very young dog.
I have no mouth, but I always reply when you call me.
I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees.
I appear once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years.
I have a thumb and four fingers, but I am not alive.
I am full of holes but still hold water.
I have layers like an ogre, and I make you cry.
I get wetter the more I dry.
I have many keys but cannot open a single lock.
I am a place where you keep your money safe.
I have teeth but I cannot eat.
I have an eye but I cannot see a thing.
I am always coming, but I never arrive.
If you say my name, you break me.
I have eyes but cannot see, skin but cannot feel.
I have a neck but I do not have a head.
A place with many stalls where people buy and sell.
I start with T, end with T, and am filled with T.
I have feathers but cannot fly. You sleep on me.
I am both a fruit and a color.
You aim for me when you throw a dart.
I am lighter than a feather, but even the strongest man cannot hold me for long.
I can be lost, found, or shared, but I have no physical form.
To use me, you must throw me away. When you are done, you bring me back.
What 5-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
Which word is written incorrectly in every dictionary?
I have a hot temper, I am often ground, and I make you sneeze.
I hold things together but have no arms. I have holes but cannot see.
I have a clove but no spice, layers but no clothes.
I can be hard to make, but I am necessary to move forward.
I can be a number, or I can be mailed to a friend.
Everyone gives it, but few people take it.
I have a light at the end, but I am dark inside.
If you lose just one of my pieces, I cannot be solved.
I can be cracked, made, told, and played.
People often fear me, but without me, you cannot grow.
I am easy to start, hard to break, and I define you.
I have a head but no face. I start a fire when struck.
I am a mistake, a bug, or a blunder.
One of the five senses; you use your hands for this.
I am common, but many people seem to lack me.
The highest point reached by a celestial body; a peak directly above.
A whirling mass of fluid or air; a chaotic draw.
A zero, or a secret code to crack.
A massive celestial object emitting exceptionally large amounts of energy.
I have no voice, yet I repeat every word you say.
The shape of your DNA; a 3D spiral curve.
A bottomless pit; gaze into it and it gazes back.
Continuous change, or a substance used in soldering.
A traditional story explaining natural or social phenomenon.
A pale blue gas; a layer that protects Earth.
A massive system of stars, stellar remnants, gas, and dust.
A celestial object with a tail of gas and dust.
A 'shooting star' that enters Earth's atmosphere.
A giant cloud of dust and gas in space.
A small star of relatively high density.
A star of great size and luminosity.
A rotating neutron star that emits a beam of electromagnetic radiation.
A region of space where gravity prevents even light from escaping.
Relating to the sun.
Relating to the moon.
A tiny square of light; millions combine to form your view.
Hidden storage used to speed up retrieval.
A microscopic invader, whether biological or digital.
The gateway ritual to access a secure system.
A distinct point of connection in a network graph.
Exactly eight bits; a mouthful of data.
I wait for your requests and deliver the data.
I float in the sky, or store your photos remotely.
A substitute; an intermediary acting on your behalf.
A coin for the arcade, or a digital proof of ownership.
A mythical creature with the body of a lion and head of a human; a riddler.
An object surviving from an earlier time, often considered holy.
A priest or medium acting as a channel for divine prophecy.
An underground room or vault beneath a church, used for burial.
A spirit being, sacred object, or symbol that serves as an emblem of a tribe.
A structure reserved for religious or spiritual rituals.
A letter of an ancient Germanic alphabet, often used in magic.
An image or representation of a god used as an object of worship.
A large vault for burying the dead, often grand.
A solemn utterance intended to invoke a supernatural power to inflict harm.
Liquid rock found beneath the Earth's surface.
A substance suspended in the air; steam or mist.
The rhythmic rising and falling of the sea.
A fiercely burning fire.
A sudden violent shaking of the ground.
Pellets of frozen rain.
White ice crystals that form on cold surfaces.
A violent disturbance of the atmosphere.
A brief, strong rush of wind.
An overflowing of a large amount of water.
The fundamental building block of life; atomic number 6.
The fourth state of matter, found in stars and lightning.
A radioactive, colorless, odorless noble gas.
A metal made by combining two or more metallic elements.
A chemical compound that contains at least one oxygen atom.
A gas lighter than air, used in balloons.
A reddish-brown metal; a great conductor of electricity.
Having a pH less than 7; sour tasting.
A basic, ionic salt; the opposite of acid.
A shiny grey-white metal often used in jewelry.
I am a living stone, a builder of reefs.
I have rows of teeth but no bones.
The grass of the sea; I produce oxygen.
Tiny giants; the fuel for the largest beast.
The deepest scar on the planet's face.
A ring of land with a lagoon in its heart.
Water too salty to drink, too heavy to mix.
I form forests without wood.
I see with sound in the crushing dark.
Self-contained breathing in the deep blue.
Part flesh, part metal; the ultimate hybrid.
The gas that lights up the rainy city streets.
Giant machines piloted by humans for combat.
A silent observer in the sky; a flying spy.
A virtual world where reality is left behind.
To break into the system and steal the data.
Very small technology; microscopic bots.
It's not real, but it feels real.
A concentrated beam of light, often a weapon.
Artificial or robotic; not natural.
The remains of a destroyed city or building.
Poisonous; dangerous to touch or breathe.
Reverted to a wild state; untamed and savage.
An underground shelter built for protection.
The powdery residue left after a fire.
A contagious bacterial disease that spreads rapidly.
To rot or decompose gradually.
An organism with genetic changes, often from radiation.
Land too poor to produce any vegetation; empty.
A terrible fate; death or destruction.
A doorway to another place or time.
A central or focal point; a connection of timelines.
A state of inactivity; frozen in time.
Relating to cause and effect.
The time yet to come.
To distort the shape of space or time.
The speed or pace of a given time.
A very brief period of time.
A sequence that repeats itself endlessly.
A break or separation in continuity.
A particle representing a quantum of light.
The messenger particle that acts as 'glue' for the nucleus.
A subatomic particle, named after Higgs, that carries force.
Intrinsic angular momentum of a particle.
A physical quantity requiring a value for each point in space.
In quantum mechanics, particles also behave like this.
The smallest unit of ordinary matter.
The extremely dense center of an atom.
A sudden transition of an electron between energy levels.
A focused stream of particles or light rays.
The fundamental unit of the brain and nervous system.
The outer layer of the cerebrum; the seat of consciousness.
The power to retain and recall past experiences.
An involuntary and nearly instantaneous movement.
Perception through sight, hearing, touch, smell, or taste.
A series of thoughts and images occurring during sleep.
A rhythmic throbbing of arteries; a signal of life.
A rounded and distinct part of the brain.
The long threadlike part of a nerve cell.
The element of a person that enables them to be aware.
An organism or cell produced asexually from one ancestor or stock.
A three-dimensional spiral curve; the famous shape of DNA.
The complete set of genes or genetic material present in a cell or organism.
A genetically determined characteristic or quality.
The smallest structural and functional unit of an organism.
The offspring of two plants or animals of different species or varieties.
To become adjusted to new conditions; a mechanism of evolution.
A minute, typically one-celled, reproductive unit capable of giving rise to a new individual.
The four nucleobases (A, C, G, T) that form the 'letters' of DNA.
One who provides biological tissue or organs to another.
A device that emits light through optical amplification.
Connects or joins two things together.
The positively charged electrode by which electrons leave a device.
The central or most important part of something.
A protein-rich liquid separated from coagulated blood.
To gradually wear away or destroy.
An automated machine, often used in assembly.
The relative size or extent of something.
A single quantity regarded as a whole in calculation.
A transparent optical element that refracts light.
The shortest distance between two points.
A 3D shape with a circular base tapering to a point.
The origin source; or the mathematical inverse of a power.
A fixed reference line for the measurement of coordinates.
A symmetrical 3D shape contained by six equal squares.
The average of a set of numbers.
The measurement of a surface or land.
A type of number that includes both rational and irrational numbers.
A part of the circumference of a circle.
Physical substance in general that occupies space.
The capacity to do work; power derived from physical or chemical resources.
The continuous expanse in which things exist and move.
The indefinite continued progress of existence.
Electromagnetic radiation that can be perceived by the human eye.
Strength or energy as an attribute of physical action or movement.
A region in which a particular force is effective.
A large body of matter with no definite shape.
A disturbance that transfers energy through matter or space.
The basic unit of a chemical element.
